title: Benjamin Bowman
chronicle: A vampire and member of The Coterie who participated in the early assessment of London's state after years of decline.
lore: Benjamin Bowman is a key figure within the vampire group known as The Coterie. His history is tied to the height of the British Empire's vampiric influence, though he was forced into hiding following the catastrophic events of the early 21st century, including the Second Inquisition and the Fall of London. He reappears in the narrative during the events of 'The Ghost Town' to salvage what remains of his former resources.

title: Bill
chronicle: An ancient vampire and former heir to the British Empire's supernatural resources, currently navigating the desolate streets of modern London.
lore: Bill was once a prominent member of the Vampire Club on the Strand in 1899. Alongside the Egyptologist, he oversaw a vast empire of resources that have since been decimated. After surviving the Fall of London and the Second Inquisition, Bill has spent over a decade in hiding. He returns to the Southbank district to meet with Anna Hyde, seeking to reclaim his standing in a city now dominated by the living.

title: Brandr the Captain
chronicle: A male vampire leader who commands The Oathbound while maintaining membership within The Coterie.
lore: Known by the moniker 'the Captain', Brandr is a figure of significant authority within the vampiric hierarchy. He serves as the primary leader for the faction known as The Oathbound. His reputation is legendary, often described in notes as 'the myth, the legend, the man'. Despite his leadership of his own group, he maintains a strategic alliance and membership with The Coterie.

title: The Toreador Anna Hyde
chronicle: A member of the Queen's Knights and a Toreador vampire who maintains strict control over her domain in Southbank.
lore: Anna Hyde is a contact for Bill and the Egyptologist. She is known for her rigid protocols, specifically forbidding the use of electronic devices or cell phones during her brief, fifteen-minute clandestine meetings. As a member of the Queen's Knights, she represents one of the surviving power structures in London following the Camarilla's collapse.

title: The Coterie
chronicle: A group of vampires that once wielded immense power during the era of the British Empire, now reduced to fragments.
lore: The Coterie was at the height of its promise in 1899, often frequenting the Vampire Club on the Strand. However, the 21st century brought a series of devastating blows: the Second Inquisition, the Fall of London, and the Conclave of Prague (2012) shattered their influence. By the time of the Second Convention of Prague in 2021, the group was largely destroyed, leaving its surviving members to crawl out of hiding years later.

title: The Oathbound
chronicle: A group led by Brandr the Captain, maintaining a presence within the supernatural underworld.
lore: The Oathbound is a faction characterized by its leadership under Brandr the Captain. While smaller or more specialized than the great sects like the Camarilla, they represent the organized remnants of vampire society that persist in the shadows of modern cities.

title: London
chronicle: A once-grand domain of the British Empire and the Camarilla, now a 'ghost town' for vampires, overrun by the living.
lore: London serves as the primary setting for the return of The Coterie. Historically, it was a bastion of vampiric power centered around locations like The Strand and Southbank. Following the 'Fall of London', the city became a hostile environment where vampires are hunted by the Second Inquisition, forcing the immortal population to abandon their electronic devices and wealth to survive.

title: 1 - Chapter One: The Ghost Town
chronicle: A narrative log detailing the return of Bill and the Egyptologist to London in January 2025.
lore: This chronicle records the decline of the Camarilla and The Coterie over the last century. Key dates include the 1899 introduction to the Vampire Club, the 2012 Conclave of Prague, and the 2021 Second Convention of Prague. It focuses on the surviving vampires' attempt to contact Anna Hyde on the Southbank and their reflections on a century of work 'down the drain' due to betrayal and the Second Inquisition.

title: The Second Inquisition
chronicle: A global movement of mortal agencies dedicated to the discovery and extermination of vampires.
lore: The Second Inquisition is responsible for the 'Fall of London' and the shattering of the Camarilla. It represents a massive shift in the 'Masquerade', where the living became proficient at hunting the dead using modern technology, forcing vampires to abandon electronic communication and retreat into hiding.

title: The Camarilla
chronicle: The primary global sect of vampires that governed London for centuries before its collapse.
lore: The Camarilla provided the structure and law that allowed The Coterie to thrive within the British Empire. Its influence was systematically dismantled by the Conclave of Prague in 2012 and the Second Convention of Prague in 2021, leading to a state of anarchy and desolation for its former members.

title: Vampire
chronicle: A race of immortal blood-drinkers who navigate a secret society governed by ancient traditions.
lore: In this setting, vampires (or Kindred) are organized into coteries and guilds. They are currently facing a period of extreme crisis known as the Second Inquisition. They are characterized by their clan affiliations (such as Toreador) and their struggle to maintain influence in a world increasingly hostile to their existence.
